evidence: Clear separation of concerns with distinct modules for models, views, forms, and admin functionality
Django-based project structure with standard MVC-like patterns (models, views, templates)
Presence of multiple layers: presentation (templates, views), business logic (admin2.py, types.py), data access (models.py)
Use of Django apps pattern with modular structure (djadmin2, example apps like blog, polls)
API layer separation with apiviews.py and serializers
Authentication and permission layers clearly separated
Migration files indicate data layer abstraction
risks: Tight coupling between Django framework and business logic may limit flexibility
Layer boundaries may become blurred in complex Django implementations
Potential for circular dependencies between layers if not carefully managed
